title: Pork loin steaks with mozzarella recipe
image: http://realfood.tesco.com/media/images/Pork Loins Steaks with Melting Mozzarella and Sage 2 hero-245ea38a-9b72-40c5-becc-159e84b2638d-0-472x310.jpg
directions: Preheat oven to gas 4, 180ºC, fan 160ºC. Place an empty baking tray in oven to heat through.
Place the pork steaks on a board, and with a sharp knife carefully make a slit horizontally into the non-fat edge of the pork. Continue until you have created a shallow pocket to stuff.
Take a slice of cheese and two sage leaves and push into the pocket. Season and wrap each steak in a slice of ham or bacon.
Heat oil in a frying pan and seal steaks on both sides. Place on the hot tray (that has been preheated in the oven) and cook for about 15-20 minutes until browned and cooked through.
Serve with seasonal green salad, crushed new potatoes and mixed olives.
ingredients: 4 lean thick pork loin steaks (about 2cm (1in) thickness)
50g	(2oz) mozzarella cheese or similar, thickly sliced into 4
4 slices Parma style ham or streaky bacon
